stories.text:
I was watching a youtube channel when I heard someone saying bragging they have found a solution to process Visa / MC payments in Russia after about a month of stalemate. That got me curious, how do they do it? Turns out they managed to escape the vetting process via processors like hxxps://donate.bot/ via Telegram.

I assume Donate are breaking the rules by doing so, but any idea how to bring this to the attention of Visa / MC? It's not about a particular individual or company, this is a blatant loophole they are exploiting with licensees from Asia.

Not sure it would be possible but I don't want to end up finding later that they managed to wash billions of dollars like this, basically rendering the sanctions useless. Therefore I hope this posts draws attention to someone from Visa / MC.

I have added some SS for reference (blurred the channel details just in case someone from Donate.bot sees this before MC / Visa does) https://imgur.com/a/LBCzEku
stories.title: Russians are evading MC/Visa merchant rules through Telegram bots

stories.text: Is there a technical reason why so many apps start out as Apple-only? I always figured it was an issue of "get it out to the most people," but as a non-dev, I'm also guessing there's a tech issue too?
stories.title: Ask HN: How different is it to make an Android app vs. an Apple app?
